都係9月15飛，唔通同巴打同一班機
野食既話可以連登search 大阪美食分享區

USJ就諗住飛之前睇下人流預測再決定買唔買fast pass

replies.msg:
其實都係大路個d地方
奈良撚鹿，鍾意既可以行埋上若草山
京都伏見稻荷大社，乜乜寺乜乜寺
大阪海遊館，梅田藍天大廈，心齋橋，箕面瀑布，USJ
如果會去神戶三宮食神戶牛可以順便去埋有馬溫泉浸返轉先返大阪

用iphone既話可以down定個apps叫乘換案內，教晒你咩月台搭邊架方向既車

誠意推薦一間壽喜燒牛，係京都叫三嶋亭，一間本店，兩間商場分店，隻壽喜燒汁食完返唔到轉頭
午市同晚市分別係晚餐隻牛靚仔啲
食過神戶mouriya都唔夠三嶋亭正
btw 我有預謀緊都係916-920去

replies.msg: 我上網睇BOOK台食飯全部都二人起 屌 唔BOOK又怕冇位

it's a safe bet that the yen will continue faing over the next four and a half months so you might as well holiday in Osaka in autumn. There's a pageant of which the final round will take place next month in osaka. I would've imagined Aiko is extremely likely to enter the final round. My friend Joe has accepted a commission to compose a waltz for the pageant as one of the contestants is going to showcase her waltz dance which we all can't wait to see. I offer heartfelt congratulations to him for having received a commission for a waltz from the pageant since it's a rare opportunity.  I too endorse the congratulations to my friend Kawai on having progressed through the preliminary round. She's a contestant in the beauty contest and I won't be surprised if she progresses through the semifinal. I remember two decades ago there was a protest where the protestors clashed out the police in osaka. I saw it on NHK then. I thought the police were not tough enough. All the riot police were holding a truncheon in one hand and a shield in the other hand. In this way you can't really fight the demonstrators since you have no free hands to catch hope of them. That's why it took four policemen to get hold of one protestor. From a fighting standpoint, some of the riot police should be holding just a shield, some just a nightstick, the other both. And all of them should be trained as to how they fight when they're holding just a baton, holding just a shield and holding both. It was complete chaos. I didn't think osaka had ever been so disastrous before. The police who I wholeheartedly supported only used tear gas in an attempt to drive the protestors away which was clearly not enough. The police shouldn't have been afraid of being criticized for using excessive force because this was utterly not the case. Those who sabotaged the nearby buildings and the railing should've been thrown in jail. The train network was paralyzed by the strikes for many weeks. The United states had already impose trade sanctions on japan at that time. The then United states president said he would take punitive measures against Japan if the police there  used excessive force. Japan was afraid that America would toughen punitive import duties further still on alcohol, food, agricultural products and clothes, and worse still they would convince the other nations to impose international economic sanctions against the country. Of course the downside was the costs of the products in America which they'd imposed import tariffs on would rise still higher. The economic sanctions against japan wouldn't be lifted until the then United states president's presidency ended two years later. The next day everybody was warned of the danger of violent clashes only to discover that it was a false alarm. There were half as many people in the street. However as long as you kept up with the news and stayed away from places where there were demonstrations it was safe in osaka. On the same day a bus crash killed twenty passengers. Detectives assigned the blame for the accident to a hailstorm and heavy snowfalls- and then a brutal murder took place in the capital. Detectives assigned hatred as the motive for this horrendous crime. For Tokyo a dazzling sun has been forecast for the while week. In Kyoto there's been a long spell of dry hot weather while in Osaka there's been a long spell of wet cold weather just right for cycling. In hiroshima the weather forecast is for a hot and sunny day and a warm and breezy night tomorrow just right for swimming. In hong kong the forecast is for sunny spells and scattered showers. For kagoshima heavy rain and a light snowfall have been forecast whereas for Miyazaki scattered hail showers and heavy rainfall have been predicted. For fukuoka a sunny and breezy day has been forecast just right for sailing while for okinawa sleet showers have been predicted. In tokyo we had fog and drizzle earlier but now its sleeting.
有冇巴打會去岡山？我多左張16 14/9j2波飛 有冇人要埋佢中間位黎.免費
上個禮拜入usj 無快證玩咗3次harry potter+minionsingle隊唯一要排多過一個鐘嘅得翼龍（平均望到係90min)

梅田空中花園睇日落幾靚，不過用周遊pass去要留意時間同埋離車站有一段路。USJ、海遊館有興趣嘅話可以去行下
大阪城心齋橋道頓堀未去過都可以去一次見識下嘅

有時間建議留耐啲喺京都，京都大把地方好行。
神戶遊客唔多，行街食牛食明石燒都好舒服。

可以去下和歌山玩一兩日, 京都玩2-3日, 神戶玩一日

就黎出發了 夜晚9點後去邊食野好 第一日好free

replies.msg: 心齋橋 有好多24小時餐廳

大阪好悶呀，心斎橋基本上冇野好行，都係普通嘅遊客區，求其食左間神戶牛，好好食 但幾貴下。

大部分時間喺京都，仲留左兩日一夜去白濱住日式溫泉酒店~ 白濱要預半日入去...因為啲車好疏，同埋個度有個tori tori市場，食燒海鮮又抵食 另外可以睇下風景，同埋去溫泉公園浸哂幾個池，露天望海架

replies.msg: 我唔係去 我提議咋
痴撚線周街都香港人比例同外國人差唔多

唔係去濕平嘅咪撚去心齋橋，蝗蟲旅客同藥妝黑工多到仆街。
成條街有一半都係大陸舖黎
今日飛一個人第一次去 見步行步
